spanishExample: No quiero que pierdas esto o te hará daño.
englishTranslation: I don’t want you to lose this or it will hurt you.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
hará: "will do/make", "he/she/it will do/make" (Hacer, future, 3rd person)
pierdas: lose, you lose (Perder, subjunctive, 2nd person)
te: "you" as an indirect object ("to you", "for you")

spanishExample: Dice que siente dolor cuando come.
englishTranslation: He says he feels pain when he eats.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
come: eats, he/she/it eats (Comer, present, 3rd person)
siente: feels, he/she/it feels (Sentir, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Perdimos el juego porque teníamos frío.
englishTranslation: We lost the game because we were cold.
vocabIncluded: perdimos: lost, we lost (Perder, preterite, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Siempre comemos además de tomar café.
englishTranslation: We always eat besides drinking coffee.
vocabIncluded: comemos: eat, we eat (Comer, present, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Quiere que yo coma para no perderme luego.
englishTranslation: He wants me to eat in order not to get lost later.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
coma: eat, I eat (Comer, subjunctive, 1st person)
para: "in order", "in order to" before an infinitive
perderse: any use of perder with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to to get lost)

spanishExample: Si pierden esto, lo pondré encima de la mesa.
englishTranslation: If they lose this, I’ll put it on top of the table.
vocabIncluded: encima: on top/upon (adverb often used with de)
pierden: lose, they lose (Perder, present, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: ¿Comes cada vez que tienes hambre?
englishTranslation: Do you eat every time you’re hungry?
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
comes: eat, you eat (Comer, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Nosotros nunca perdemos, pero tú ya perdiste.
englishTranslation: We never lose, but you already lost.
vocabIncluded: perdemos: lose, we lose (Perder, present, 1st person plural)
perdiste: lost, you lost (Perder, preterite, 2nd person)
ya: adverb meaning "anymore", "already", and a variety of other time-related things

spanishExample: La gente nunca debería sentir ni odio ni hambre.
englishTranslation: People should never feel either hatred or hunger.
vocabIncluded: debería: should, he/she/it should (Deber, conditional, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Probablemente solo comen ese tipo de comida.
englishTranslation: They probably only eat that type of food.
vocabIncluded: comen: eat, they eat (Comer, present, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Si pierdes, hablaré de tu secreto.
englishTranslation: If you lose, I will talk about your secret.
vocabIncluded: de used to mean "about", as in "hablar de"
hablaré: will speak, I will speak (Hablar, future, 1st person)
pierdes: lose, you lose (Perder, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: ¡Ve adentro de la casa y come!
englishTranslation: Go inside the house and eat!
vocabIncluded: adentro: inside (adverb often used with de)

spanishExample: Es una pena que yo pierda por esas cosas que sucedieron.
englishTranslation: It’s a shame that I lose because of those things that occurred.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
pierda: lose, I lose (Perder, subjunctive, 1st person)
sucedieron: occurred/happened, they occurred/happened (Suceder, preterite, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: No quiero que pierdas simplemente porque no has comido.
englishTranslation: I don’t want you to lose simply because you haven’t eaten.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
has: "have", "you have" before a participle (Haber, present, 2nd person)
pierdas: lose, you lose (Perder, subjunctive, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Aunque podamos perder, es un placer tener este juego con ustedes.
englishTranslation: Even if we might lose, it’s a pleasure having this game with you (plural).
vocabIncluded: podamos: "be able", "we be able" (Poder, subjunctive, 1st person plural)
ustedes: plural "you" after a preposition (prep. pronoun)

spanishExample: Perdí mi teléfono o alrededor de la casa o adentro del auto.
englishTranslation: I lost my phone either around the house or inside the car.
vocabIncluded: adentro: inside (adverb often used with de)
alrededor: around (adverb often used with de)
perdí: lost, I lost (Perder, preterite, 1st person)

spanishExample: Eso no sucedió anoche, él perdió la semana pasada.
englishTranslation: That didn’t occur last night, he lost last week.
vocabIncluded: perdió: lost, he/she/it lost (Perder, preterite, 3rd person)
sucedió: occurred/happened, he/she/it occurred/happened(Suceder, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: No es un secreto que estas cosas suceden.
englishTranslation: It’s not a secret that these things happen.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
suceden: occur/happen, they occur/happen (Suceder, present, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Cuando eso suceda, le va a hacer daño.
englishTranslation: When that occurs, it’s going to hurt him.
vocabIncluded: le: "her/him" as an indirect object ("to her/him", "for her/him")
suceda: occur/happen, he/she/it occur/happen(Suceder, subjunctive, 3rd person)
using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")

spanishExample: No sé qué ha sucedido detrás de esa casa.
englishTranslation: I don’t know what has occurred behind that house.
vocabIncluded: "qué" in an implied question, not an actual question
detrás: behind/in the back (adverb often used with de)
ha: "has", "he/she/it has" before a participle (Haber, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Todo puede suceder, incluso perder tu honor.
englishTranslation: Anything can occur, including losing your honor.

spanishExample: Es un placer estar aquí, aunque tenga calor.
englishTranslation: It’s a pleasure being here, even if I’m hot.

spanishExample: Probablemente dejó su teléfono encima de la mesa anoche.
englishTranslation: He probably left his phone on top of the table last night.
vocabIncluded: dejó: stopped/left/allowed, he/she/it   stopped/left/allowed (Dejar, preterite, 3rd person)
encima: on top/upon (adverb often used with de)

spanishExample: ¡Pierde ahora para que no sientas dolor luego!
englishTranslation: Lose now so you don’t feel pain later!
vocabIncluded: sientas: feel, you feel (Sentir, subjunctive, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Simplemente perdieron su honor, además de su dinero.
englishTranslation: They simply lost their honor, besides their money.
vocabIncluded: perdieron: lost, they lost (Perder, preterite, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: No quiero comer ahora, además, comeré en la casa de mi abuela.
englishTranslation: I don’t want to eat now; besides, I’ll eat at my grandmother’s house.
vocabIncluded: comeré: will eat, I will eat (Comer, future, 1st person)

spanishExample: Ha perdido todo, incluso su casa.
englishTranslation: He has lost everything, including his house.
vocabIncluded: ha: "has", "he/she/it has" before a participle (Haber, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Si miras alrededor, puedes ver el odio.
englishTranslation: If you look around, you can see the hatred.
vocabIncluded: alrededor: around (adverb often used with de)
miras: look, you look (Mirar, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Lo que está sucediendo es que ellos están perdiendo.
englishTranslation: What’s happening is that they are losing.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
"que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)

spanishExample: Comí en la habitación detrás de esa puerta.
englishTranslation: I ate in the room behind that door.
vocabIncluded: comí: ate, I ate (Comer, preterite, 1st person)
detrás: behind/in the back (adverb often used with de)

spanishExample: Si como ahora, pierdo mi dinero.
englishTranslation: If I eat now, I lose my money.
vocabIncluded: como: eat, I eat (Comer, present, 1st person)
pierdo: lose, I lose (Perder, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: ¿Comiste aunque tenías frío?
englishTranslation: Did you eat even though you were cold?
vocabIncluded: comiste: ate, you ate (Comer, preterite, 2nd person)

spanishExample: ¡No pierda! Sería una pena.
englishTranslation: (Formal) Don’t lose! It would be a shame.
vocabIncluded: sería: "would be", "he/she/it would be" (Ser, conditional, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Comió lo que estaba encima de la mesa.
englishTranslation: He ate what was on top of the table.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
comió: ate, he/she/it ate (Comer, preterite, 3rd person)
encima: on top/upon (adverb often used with de)

spanishExample: No está comiendo y, encima, no quiero que coma.
englishTranslation: She isn’t eating and, on top of that, I don’t want her to eat.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
coma: eat, he/she/it eat (Comer, subjunctive, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Veamos qué sucede, además de quién viene.
englishTranslation: Let’s see what happens, besides who comes.
vocabIncluded: "qué" in an implied question, not an actual question
sucede: occurs/happens, he/she/it occurs/happens (Suceder, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: No creo que pierda por el calor.
englishTranslation: I don’t think she’ll lose because of the heat.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
creo: believe, I believe (Creer, present, 1st person)
pierda: lose, he/she/it lose (Perder, subjunctive, 3rd person)
